assemble.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose
assemble.translation[0].definitions[0].e: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
He looked around at the assembled company (=all the people who had come there).
She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
assemble.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to put all the parts of something together
assemble.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
assemble.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to make a product by putting parts together
assemble.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The factory will assemble GM pickup trucks for sale in the Chinese market.
assemble.translation[1].definitions[1].d: if a financial institution assembles a loan, it finds lenders who are willing to make part of the loan
assemble.translation[1].definitions[1].e: It is attempting to assemble $1 billion of credit.
assemble.translation[1].definitions[2].d: if an organization assembles, it meets officially
assemble.translation[1].definitions[2].e: The 12,000-member International Bar Association will assemble in New York City, Sept 1923.
